definition: to lessen or to try to lessen the seriousness or extent of (something, such as a fault or offense) by making partial excuses : mitigate, — see also extenuating
examples: There is no economic analysis that can extenuate bigotry.
… all the lies that society tells to justify its values and extenuate its conduct …

definition: to lessen the strength or effect of (something) : weaken
examples: … it was true that he was an old friend and that … she felt a desire not to extenuate such ties.
